text: Duke University Hospital is a 957-bed hospital and an academic tertiary care facility located in Durham, North Carolina, United States. Made in 1930, it is the main teaching hospital for the Duke University Health System, a network of physicians and hospitals serving Durham County and Wake County, North Carolina, and surrounding areas, as well as one of three Level I referral centers for the Research Triangle of North Carolina (the other two are UNC Hospitals in nearby Chapel Hill and WakeMed Raleigh in Raleigh). It is affiliated with the Duke University School of Medicine. == References == Category:University hospitals in the United States Category:1930 establishments in the United States Category:Organizations based in North Carolina
title: Duke University Hospital
